    }

<p><b>Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.</b> is a South Korean multinational electronics conglomerate owned by <b>Samsung Group</b> and accounting for roughly 75% of the group's revenue. Samsung is a major manufacturer of electronic products such as <a href="/wiki/microprocessors" class="mw-redirect" title="microprocessors">microprocessors</a>, <a href="/w/index.php?title=flash_memory&action=edit&redlink=1" class="new" title="flash memory (page does not exist)">flash memory</a>, and many other <a href="/wiki/integrated_circuits" class="mw-redirect" title="integrated circuits">integrated circuits</a>. Samsung is also the world's largest manufacturer of mobile phones, tablets, and televisions.
</p><p>In May 2013, Samsung sold off its <a href="/w/index.php?title=samsung/s3&action=edit&redlink=1" class="new" title="samsung/s3 (page does not exist)">S3</a> families of <a href="/wiki/4-bit_architecture" title="4-bit architecture">4-bit</a> and <a href="/wiki/8-bit_architecture" title="8-bit architecture">8-bit</a> <a href="/wiki/microcontrollers" class="mw-redirect" title="microcontrollers">microcontrollers</a> to <a href="/w/index.php?title=Ixys&action=edit&redlink=1" class="new" title="Ixys (page does not exist)">Ixys</a>, parent of <a href="/w/index.php?title=Zilog&action=edit&redlink=1" class="new" title="Zilog (page does not exist)">Zilog</a>, for $50M.
</p>
